ait.state_engine module

This module implements a finite state machine generator. Based on a given INIT state and a list of predefined events, the state engine applies each event on the INIT state. If the transition creats a new state, the engine will repeatedly apply each event on the new states until all the state/event are executed.

class ait.state_engine.StateEngine(init_state: State, events: list[Event], options: dict = None)[source]

property matrix: dict[str, dict[str, State | dict[str, State]]]

The matrix of the state machine The matrix is a dictionary where the keys are state names and the values are dictionaries containing event names and their corresponding target states. For example

martix = {
    'init_state': {
        "source": state0,
        "transitions": {
            "event_name1": state1,
            "event_name2": state2,
            ...
        }
    },
    ...
}

Parameters:

  • source (State) – the source state

  • target (State) – the target state

  • event (Event) – the event
